Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I think that my theory might be more likely... and that was because he was making txs that are dust (by disabling mempool checks) the nodes cannot add these txns to the mempool and thus invalidate the block, problem with this theory is that there is no debug prints saying the block was invalid... it simplyt never arrives

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Maximum is 800 Kibibyte per oraclesdata for `D` oracle type

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: As well as for any other oracle

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: 10000 bytes max size per opreturn

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: capped at 8kb

Author: smk762 -  dracocanis ominator#7640
Content: so not breaking the block on one write then

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: just because 16bits can do 65536 doesnt mean oracles can make 64kb opreturn
